{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of severe abdominal pain and nausea, along with the physical findings of dusky discoloration of the hepatic colonic flexure and an adjacent segment of the transverse colon, suggest ischemia of the bowel. The hepatic flexure and the transverse colon are supplied by the superior mesenteric artery, so occlusion of a branch of this artery would most likely cause the patient's condition.", "answer_choice": "D. Superior mesenteric artery"}
